skill.name: database-schema-designer
skill.description: Use this skill when designing database schemas for relational (SQL) or document (NoSQL) databases. Provides normalization guidelines, indexing strategies, migration patterns, and performance optimization techniques. Ensures scalable, maintainable, and performant data models.

skill.author: AI Agent Hub

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing SQL templates, database design checklists, and schema patterns. The static analyzer flagged 202 issues but ALL are false positives caused by the scanner misidentifying SQL keywords (FLOAT, DECIMAL) as 'weak cryptographic algorithms' and database terminology (EXPLAIN, INFORMATION_SCHEMA) as 'system reconnaissance'. No executable code, network access, or filesystem operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Designing database schemas from scratch or optimizing existing ones is complex. This skill provides proven patterns for normalization, indexing, migrations, and performance optimization across SQL and NoSQL databases.
actual_capabilities: Guide schema design for SQL and NoSQL databases
Create indexing strategies for query optimization
Design database migrations with rollback support
Optimize database performance and avoid N+1 queries
limitations: Does not execute SQL or modify databases directly
Does not connect to database servers
Does not generate complete production code without user input
Cannot tune databases based on live query metrics

use_cases.title: Build robust data models
use_cases.description: Design new database schemas following best practices for integrity, performance, and scalability.

use_cases.title: Plan safe migrations
use_cases.description: Create reversible migration scripts and zero-downtime deployment strategies for schema changes.

use_cases.title: Optimize query performance
use_cases.description: Improve slow queries through indexing strategies and denormalization patterns.

prompt_templates.title: New Schema Design
prompt_templates.scenario: Create tables for a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a SQL schema for a [feature description]. Include tables, columns, data types, primary keys, foreign keys, constraints, and recommended indexes.

prompt_templates.title: Schema Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this schema design and identify issues with normalization, missing indexes, constraint violations, or potential performance problems.

prompt_templates.title: Migration Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a migration plan to [describe change] with zero downtime. Include up migration, down migration, and validation steps.

prompt_templates.title: NoSQL Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a MongoDB schema for [use case]. Decide when to embed vs reference data and create appropriate indexes.

output_examples.input: Design a schema for a blog application with users, posts, comments, and categories
output: users table: id, username, email, bio, created_at, updated_at
posts table: id, user_id, category_id, title, content, published_at, status
comments table: id, post_id, user_id, content, created_at
categories table: id, name, slug, description
Foreign key constraints with ON DELETE CASCADE

output_examples.input: Create a migration to add a status column to orders table without downtime
output: Step 1: Add nullable column with default
Step 2: Deploy code that writes to new column
Step 4: Make column required with NOT NULL constraint
Include both UP and DOWN migration scripts

best_practices: Model the domain first, not the UI. Let business requirements drive schema design.
Always create reversible migrations with both up and down scripts.
Add indexes strategically based on actual query patterns, not proactively on every column.
anti_patterns: Using FLOAT for money values causes rounding errors. Use DECIMAL instead.
Storing multiple values in a single column violates 1NF and breaks query flexibility.
Skipping foreign key constraints leads to orphaned records and data integrity issues.

faq.question: Which databases are supported?
faq.answer: PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, SQL Server, Oracle for SQL. MongoDB, CouchDB for document databases.

faq.question: What are the size limits?
faq.answer: No inherent limits. The skill works for small apps and large enterprise schemas with millions of rows.

faq.question: How to integrate with ORM tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides schema patterns that work with Prisma, TypeORM, Django ORM, Hibernate, and other tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only provides guidance. It never connects to databases or stores any data.

faq.question: Schema performance is slow. What now?
faq.answer: Use EXPLAIN to analyze query plans. Add indexes on WHERE and JOIN columns. Consider denormalization for read-heavy workloads.

faq.question: How is this different from ORM migrations?
faq.answer: ORM tools generate migrations automatically. This skill helps you design better schemas and migrations manually when needed.
